article_summary:
This bill, known as S. 169 or “I2”, clearly has bipartisan support, and aims to broadly reform high skilled immigration.
The big question is whether the current Congress is capable of enacting stand-alone immigration legislation that focuses only on skilled immigration.
The bill was originally introduced by Senator Hatch in January, 2013 but it was quickly overshadowed by the Senate’s comprehensive immigration reform bill, and neither bill made any headway in Congress.
Thursday, January 15, 2015On January 13, 2015 Senators Orrin Hatch (R-UT), Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), Marco Rubio (R-FL), Chris Coons (D-DE), Jeff Flake (R-AZ), and Richard Blumenthal (D-CT) introduced the Immigration Innovation Act of 2013 into the Senate.
For years business groups across the country have been clamoring for the types of reforms reflected in this bill.
